page.title: 06FARMING IN WOODSPRING
page.content: Although fewer people are employed on farms now than formerly, farming is the only source of employment in King- ston Seymour and Wick St. Lawrence. The average size of a farm holding is 100 acres and most farms are owner occupied. Cattle are raised for milk or beef. It requires about half an acre of land to support one cow. Sheep are reared on some farms. Farmers produce hay in the early summer if there is enough sun to dry the grass. Silage is made for winter feed. The grass can be cut twice a year if it grows well. No other fodder crops are grown. Some farms have apple orchards. The apples are used for cider making. Nowadays the apples are taken to a factory outside the villages, and cider is not made on the premises as it was when cider was the staple drink.
